name: David Letterman
monologue: This week is Fleet Week in New York City. A couple of sailors ran into former Gov. Eliot Spitzer and asked him where they could find some girls.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: The Gulf oil spill is getting so bad that next fall, seawater will be $4 a gallon.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: President Obama is becoming frustrated about the oil spill and he reportedly said, “Plug the damn hole.” That’s the same thing he says whenever Joe Biden starts talking.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: The market had such a bad day that over at Merrill Lynch, they tried to lynch Merrill.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: A Massachusetts man was taken to the hospital this week after being sucked into a sausage-making machine. They’re calling him a “manwich.”

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Last night was the finale of “Dancing With the Stars” and Kate Gosselin made an appearance. I don’t want to say it was bad, but this morning, the Pakistani Taliban took credit for it.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: I heard that Tiger Woods is building a new house in Florida. You can tell it’s Tiger’s house because it has a front, a back, and a side that nobody knows about.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: At a shareholders meeting, Amazon’s CEO said that a color version of the Kindle is still a long way out. Then Apple stood up and said, “No it isn’t.”

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: The NBA is coming out with edible basketball logos that can be placed on a pizza. Of course, any pizza with the Knicks logo on it has to come with a choke hazard.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: I want you all to know something. To me, you’re all American idols.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Lee Dewyze is the new karaoke champion. I don’t know who he took the crown from, but the important thing is that it’s over.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: It was Simon Cowell’s last night on “American Idol.” He had a special way of telling us that we suck.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Now the only people that we have to yell at us are Judge Judy and Dr. Phil.
